1.text: My soul is weary of my life, I will let go my speech against myself, I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.

2.text: I will say to God: Do not condemn me: tell me why thou judgest me so.

3.text: Doth it seem good to thee that thou shouldst calumniate me, and oppress me, the work of thy own hands, and help the counsel of the wicked?

4.text: Hast thou eyes of flesh: or, shalt thou see as man seeth?

5.text: Are thy days as the days of man, and are thy years as the times of men:

6.text: That thou shouldst inquire after my iniquity, and search after my sin?

7.text: And shouldst know that I have done no wicked thing, whereas there is no man that can deliver out of thy hand.

8.text: Thy hands have made me, and fashioned me wholly round about, and dost thou thus cast me down headlong on a sudden?

9.text: Remember, I beseech thee, that thou hast made me as the clay, and thou wilt bring me into dust again.

10.text: Hast thou not milked me as milk, and curdled me like cheese?

11.text: Thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh: thou hast put me together with bones and sinews:

12.text: Thou hast granted me life and mercy, and thy visitation hath preserved my spirit.

13.text: Although thou conceal these things in thy heart, yet I know that thou rememberest all things.

14.text: If I have sinned and thou hast spared me for an hour: why dost thou not suffer me to be clean from my iniquity?

15.text: And if I be wicked, woe unto me: and if just, I shall not lift up my head, being filled with affliction and misery.

16.text: And for pride thou wilt take me as a lioness, and returning thou tormentest me wonderfully.

17.text: Thou renewest thy witnesses against me, and multipliest thy wrath upon me, and pains war against me.

18.text: Why didst thou bring me forth out of the womb: O that I had been consumed that eye might not see me!

19.text: I should have been as if I had not been, carried from the womb to the grave.

20.text: Shall not the fewness of my days be ended shortly? suffer me, therefore, that I may lament my sorrow a little:

21.text: Before I go, and return no more, to a land that is dark and covered with the mist of death:

22.text: A land of misery and darkness, where the shadow of death, and no order, but everlasting horror dwelleth.
